articles.summary: The strongest storms to pummel the US north-east are getting stronger as sea surface temperatures rise, like hurricanes further south, so do the storms.    the sea surface temperature is rising due to the rise in sea-level rise and the increase in the number of storms.

articles.title: Indigenous islanders lose high-profile climate case against Australian government
articles.author: France24
articles.summary: Indigenous Australians on a string of climate-vulnerable islands suffered a major legal defeat in their case on Tuesday. The case was brought by a group of environmental groups. The group is seeking compensation for the damage caused by climate change.       .

articles.title: Madagascar launches $7 million initiative to protect coasts from climate change
articles.author: APO
articles.summary: Madagascar has officially launched a landmark initiative aimed at enhancing climate resilience. Nearly 100,000 people are expected to benefit directly across four key coastal regions: Beny, Menabe, Diana, and Diana. It aims to restore critical coastal ecosystems and improve livelihoods across vulnerable regions.

articles.title: Heatwaves could slash Cyprus GDP by 3%, study warns
articles.author: Philenews
articles.summary: Cyprus is projected to suffer the most severe economic impact in Europe from heatwaves. Climate change is expected to push annual losses up to 3% of GDP by 2060 if no adaptation measures are taken, according to a study published in Nature Communications. The study examines current and indirect effects spread through the service sector.

articles.title: Seeding gender empowerment: Women farmers in Peru contend with climate change (UNOG - United Nations Office at Geneva)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Ácora, in the southeast corner of Peru, is one of the regions most affected by drought and floods. The levels of lakes are plummeting and the crops are shriveling due to drought. The region is almost 3,800 km above sea level.

articles.title: ‘My heart is broken': Indigenous Australians lose landmark climate case
articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: Federal court says government is not obliged to shield residents of Torres Strait Islands from effects of climate change. Read more Al Jazeera Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera here.    .   ...   "Al Jazeera" is breaking news and world news from al Jazeera.

articles.title: Social services department warned Tanya Plibersek she faces uphill battle amid ‘political polarisation'
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Brief obtained under freedom of information laws shows new minister told of 'increased risk of entrenched disadvantage' in Australia due to rising geopolitical tensions, political polarisation and political polarization, according to the brief obtained under Freedom of Information Act.

articles.title: Trump admin says it won't publish major climate change reports on NASA website
articles.author: NBC News
articles.summary: The Trump administration wants to make it harder to find legally mandated scientific assessments of climate change's impact on the U.S. people and the environment. The move is a step toward making it harder for the public to find such reports legally required by law.

articles.title: Australia's red wine glut likely to get worse
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Australia crushed more red wine grapes this year, but fewer people are drinking it. There are warnings of a worsening wine glut in the country. The wine industry is worried about the impact on the environment and the economy. The government is trying to prevent the wine glut.

articles.title: Florida citrus industry sees lowest production in more than 100 years due to hurricanes, disease
articles.author: Orlando Weekly
articles.summary: Florida's citrus industry ended the 2024-2025 growing due to hurricanes and citrus greening disease, which killed off the industry's growth prospects.       in Florida's industry is no longer growing, because of the hurricanes and the disease.

articles.title: Drought declared in East and West Midlands in driest start to year since 1976
articles.author: London Evening Standard
articles.summary: Lincolnshire, Northamptonshire, East Anglia and Thames move into prolonged dry weather status, while three further areas are in dry weather.    Lancashire, Northants and Northants, and Thames are now in dry conditions.

articles.title: National Adaptation Plan to tackle climate change risks being prepared
articles.author: Muskat Daily
articles.summary: Oman has stepped up preparations for the National Adaptation Plan (NAP) to enhance its response to climate change. A three-day workshop in Muscat brings together national and international experts to chart the path forward. The workshop aims to double national efforts to address the growing challenges of climate change in Oman.

articles.title: Now scientists blame REDUCTIONS in air pollution in China for the acceleration in global warming ...
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Reductions in air pollution in East Asia are to blame for the rapid acceleration in global warming. While air pollution kills millions, it also whitens clouds. This makes the clouds reflect more sunlight, which in turn makes them warmer and more vulnerable to climate change.

articles.title: Melting Arctic ice bolstering North Atlantic Ocean currents, for now
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Climate change is disrupting ecosystems and upending once-stable weather patterns. There are more frequent wildfires, rising sea levels and changing weather patterns due to climate change. One of the effects of climate change is increasing the frequency of wildfires and sea level rise.

articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: Practice UPSC Mains GS-3 answers on climate change's link to the UPSC's website on how to answer questions on the topic. It's called "Climate Change and UPSC Main's G3 Answers".    "Climate change is linked to global warming."

articles.title: This Small Texas Town Is Fighting Back Against Big Ammonia
articles.author: Resilience
articles.summary: YaREN's proposed plant poses an immediate threat to the environment, especially the environment of people living near YaREN.   It will pollute the atmosphere with greenhouse gasses. It will cause climate harm to people living close to it, as well as others.

articles.title: Sugars from the salty ocean are responsible for a large part of the ice nuclei ...
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Current climate models have so far been unable to reproduce clouds over the Southern Ocean around Antarctica, according to the scientists.       - a problem with the current climate models is that they can't reproduce the clouds over Southern Ocean, which is a problem for climate models.

articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: Aboard the flotilla to Gaza, activist Tania Safi slams Australia's Tel Aviv embassy for urging her to drop the mission to Gaza. articles.title: World risks up to $39 trillion in economic losses from vanishing wetlands, report says
articles.author: Bahrain News Agency
articles.summary: The global destruction of wetlands may mean the loss of $39 trillion in economic benefits by 2050, according to a report by the Convention on Wetlands released on Tuesday. Some 22% of wetlands support fisheries, agriculture and flood control, which may be destroyed by 2050.

articles.title: It's hot but it's here: Gilbert heads back to school this week
articles.author: Tom Blodgett Mail
articles.summary: Phoenix hit 118 degrees last week. Kids are back in school this week. The three school districts that serve Gilbert are about to launch their school years. The temperature reached 118 degrees in Phoenix last week, but it's back to normal this week in the other districts.

articles.title: Stick to the facts
articles.summary: Kimberly Izar wrote an article about extreme weather affecting New York's farming industry. Ivan Orisek, M.Sc (Eng.) lives in Forestburgh, NY, and he disagrees with the claims made in the article. He points out that scientists use scientific data.
